content.description: Taco Flavored Kisses is a good, slab boulder problem with a high step crux. This is really fun!
content.location:
It is the right slab line in the

Purity Ring

alcove.

content.description:
Purity Ring is an absolutely classic 45 degree overhanging thin hands to ringlocks crack. Sit start with a left thin handjam and right hand fingerstack. Work your way up utilizing paddle hands, fingerstacks, and ringlocks. About halfway up, the crack jogs slightly right and narrows where you will have to fire on all cylinders for the next 8 or so feet. This climb doesn't let up until both of your feet are over the lip of the overhang. The rest of the climb is easy and enjoyable 5.4 fingercrack to the top.

It was named for the pureness of the ringlocks on this line - there are no feet or crimps outside of the crack.
content.protection: At least 4 pads and a spotter. Helmet optional.
content.location:
Follow the approach from the previous, and keep an eye out on your left as you head up the trail. There will be an obvious outcropping of boulders in a gully - this one has a crack cleaving the boulder in half and is about 10 feet off the trail.

The GPS coordinates are approximately: 39.419796, -105.262623.

content.description: This is pronounced with a soft "J".... and has funky mantel on a rounded boulder. Start with your left hand on the low crimp rail and your right hand on a small dimple/sidepull thing, and go up and over.
content.location:
It is on the boulder to the right of

Purity Ring

in the little cove.

content.description:
This is yet another nice splitter boulder in the Spires. Sit start on tips locks, then make some hard moves with horrible foot holds to gain better jams. The topout slab has less-than-ideal rock, but it is low angle with good jams.

Maybe it is not quite classic and more of a 3.5 star problem out of 4, due to the looseness up top.
content.protection: 3 or more pads and a spotter. Tape up - this one bites.
content.location:
Go just past

Purity Ring

, and cut left once you are able to cross the gully. You will catch a faint climber's trail that traverses directly across the hill to the base of the boulder. The boulder faces downhill.

GPS: 39.419317, -105.263574

content.description:
Chipotle Away ascends a tall slab with tricky movement and a bad landing. This is classic!, but don't fall.... Start left of "

Taco Flavored Kisses

," and move up and left on the slab. You end up between a subtle butt cheeks feature.

It is supposedly similar to the crux of "

Green Project

."
content.location:
This is the left slab line in the

Purity Ring

area.
